problem_text: Suppose that for every Sylow subgroup P of a finite group G and every maximal subgroup V of P there is a σ-soluble subgroup T such that V T = G. Is it true that then G is σ-soluble? A. N. Skiba
answer: Yes, it is true (A.-M. Liu, W. Guo, I. N. Safonova, A. N. Skiba, J. Algebra, 585 (2021), 280–293); another solution using CFSG is in (S. F. Kamornikov, V. N. Tyutyanov, Trudy Inst. Mat. Mekh. UrO RAN, 27, no. 1 (2021), 98–102 (Russian); X. Yi, S. F. Kamornikov, V. N. Tyutyanov, Probl. Physics, Math. Techn., 46, no. 1 (2021), 50–53).
